newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Kia Steel news seen buoying Seoul shrs.
newsitem.headline: Kia Steel news seen buoying Seoul shrs.

text.p: Kia Group's announcement that the Hyundai and Daewoo groups would buy a stake in Kia's most troubled unit was expected to buoy Seoul stocks on Friday, brokers said.
"That's good news. It raises hopes of an early resolution to the Kia problems," said Lee Young-won of Daewoo Securities.
The composite index ended 0.77 of a point lower at 726.12 on Thursday.
But brokers said falling customer deposits with brokerage houses clouded the prospects of a strong rebound.
Such deposits are now estimated at 3.03 trillion won, compared with a yearly high of 3.6 trillion in mid-June.
Hyundai Motor Co and unlisted Daewoo Motor Co had agreed in principle to buy the stakes to save Kia Steel, which had run into serious financial troubles after heavy capital investment.
"Shares of Kia companies are expected to fare well today," said Choo Hee-yup of Dongwon Securities.
Under the agreement, Hyundai, Daewoo and Kia Motors Corp would form a consortium to run Kia Steel, it said. The three carmakers will have equal stakes in Kia Steel.
